surprised and shocked, to say the

hours" of the morning, he went
out to the place where he had
left his car, reached out with his
key towards the door—and found
nothing! (Dave swears he was
sober.)
He and his fellow pessengers
had to go home by taxi, and Levy
was still in search of a very nice
maroon Chevrolet sedean, 1934
model, at last reports.

At least one man admits he
had rather a bad night of it last
Friday. Dave Levy, member of
the Student Council and the
NEWS-LETTER staff, was rather
surprised and shocked, to say the
least, when, in the "wee sma'
hours" of the morning, he went
out to the place where he had
left his car, reached out with his
key towards the door—and found
nothing! (Dave swears he was
sober.)
He and his fellow pessengers
had to go home by taxi, and Levy
was still in search of a very nice
maroon Chevrolet sedean, 1934
model, at last reports.
